verses.verse: Of the children of Ammon<WH1121>. Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Hath Israel<WH3478> no sons<WH1121>? hath he no heir<WH3423>? why then doth Malcam<WH4428> possess<WH3423> Gad<WH1410>, and his people<WH5971> dwell<WH3427> in the cities thereof<WH5892>?

Therefore <WH3117>, behold, the days come<WH935>, saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, that I will cause an alarm<WH8643> of war<WH4421> to be heard<WH8085> against Rabbah<WH7237> of the children of Ammon<WH1121>; and it shall become a desolate<WH8077> heap<WH8510>, and her daughters<WH1323> shall be burned<WH3341> with fire<WH784>: then shall Israel<WH3478> possess<WH3423> them that did possess<WH3423> him<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.

Wail <WH3213>, O Heshbon<WH2809>, for Ai<WH5857> is laid waste<WH7703>; cry<WH6817>, ye daughters<WH1323> of Rabbah<WH7237>, gird<WH2296> you with sackcloth<WH8242>: lament<WH5594>, and run to and fro<WH7751> among the fences<WH4428>; for Malcam shall go<WH3212> into captivity<WH1473>, his priests<WH3548> and his princes<WH8269> together<WH3162>.

Wherefore gloriest<WH1984> thou in the valleys<WH6010>, thy flowing<WH2100> valley<WH6010>, O backsliding<WH7728> daughter<WH1323>? that trusted<WH982> in her treasures<WH214>, saying<WH935>, Who shall come unto me?

Behold <WH935>, I will bring a fear<WH6343> upon thee<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH136>, Jehovah<WH136> of hosts<WH6635>, from all that are round about<WH5439> thee<WH5080>; and ye shall be driven out every man<WH376> right forth<WH6440>, and there shall be none to gather together<WH6908> the fugitives<WH5074>.
But afterward<WH310> I will bring back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.

Of Edom<WH123>. Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>: Is wisdom<WH2451> no more in Teman<WH8487>? is counsel<WH6098> perished<WH6> from the prudent<WH995>? is their wisdom<WH2451> vanished<WH5628>?

Flee <WH5127> ye<WH6437>, turn back, dwell<WH3427> in the depths<WH6009>, O inhabitants<WH3427> of Dedan<WH1719>; for I will bring<WH935> the calamity<WH343> of Esau<WH6215> upon him<WH6256>, the time that I shall visit him<WH6485>.

If grape-gatherers<WH1219> came<WH935> to thee<WH7604>, would they not leave some gleaning grapes<WH5955>? if thieves<WH1590> by night<WH3915>, would they not destroy<WH7843> till they had enough<WH1767>?

But I have made Esau<WH6215> bare<WH2834>, I have uncovered<WH1540> his secret places<WH4565>, and he shall not be able<WH3201> to hide<WH2247> himself<WH2233>: his seed is destroyed<WH7703>, and his brethren<WH251>, and his neighbors<WH7934>; and he is not.
Leave <WH5800> thy fatherless children<WH3490>, I will preserve them alive<WH2421>; and let thy widows<WH490> trust in me<WH982>.

For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Behold<WH4941>, they to whom it pertained not to drink<WH8354> of the cup<WH3563> shall assuredly<WH8354> drink<WH8354>; and art thou he that shall altogether<WH5352> go unpunished<WH5352>? thou shalt not go unpunished<WH5352>, but thou shalt surely<WH8354> drink<WH8354>.

For I have sworn<WH7650> by myself<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>, that Bozrah<WH1224> shall become an astonishment<WH8047>, a reproach<WH2781>, a waste<WH2721>, and a curse<WH7045>; and all the cities<WH5892> thereof shall be perpetual<WH5769> wastes<WH2723>.

I have heard<WH8085> tidings<WH8052> from Jehovah<WH3068>, and an ambassador<WH6735> is sent<WH7971> among the nations<WH1471>, saying<WH6908>, Gather yourselves together, and come<WH935> against her<WH6965>, and rise up to the battle<WH4421>.
For <WH5414>, behold, I have made thee small<WH6996> among the nations<WH1471>, and despised<WH959> among men<WH120>.

As for thy terribleness<WH8606>, the pride<WH2087> of thy heart<WH3820> hath deceived<WH5377> thee<WH7931>, O thou that dwellest in the clefts<WH2288> of the rock<WH5553>, that holdest<WH8610> the height<WH4791> of the hill<WH1389>: though thou shouldest make thy nest<WH7064> as high<WH1361> as the eagle<WH5404>, I will bring thee down<WH3381> from thence<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.
And Edom<WH123> shall become an astonishment<WH8047>: every one that passeth<WH5674> by it shall be astonished<WH8074>, and shall hiss<WH8319> at all the plagues thereof<WH4347>.

As in the overthrow<WH4114> of Sodom<WH5467> and Gomorrah<WH6017> and the neighbor<WH7934> cities thereof<WH559>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>, no man<WH376> shall dwell<WH3427> there<WH1121>, neither shall any son of man<WH120> sojourn therein<WH1481>.

Behold <WH5927>, he shall come up like a lion<WH738> from the pride<WH1347> of the Jordan<WH3383> against the strong<WH386> habitation<WH5116>: for I will suddenly<WH7280> make them run away<WH7323> from it<WH977>; and whoso is chosen, him will I appoint<WH6485> over it<WH3259>: for who is like me? and who will appoint me a time? and who is the shepherd<WH7462> that will stand<WH5975> before me<WH6440>?

Therefore hear<WH8085> ye the counsel<WH6098> of Jehovah<WH3068>, that he hath taken<WH3289> against Edom<WH123>; and his purposes<WH4284>, that he hath purposed<WH2803> against the inhabitants<WH3427> of Teman<WH8487>: Surely they shall drag them away<WH5498>, even the little<WH6810> ones of the flock<WH6629>; surely he shall make their habitation<WH5116> desolate over them<WH8074>.
The earth<WH776> trembleth<WH7493> at the noise<WH6963> of their fall<WH5307>; there is a cry<WH6818>, the noise<WH6963> whereof is heard<WH8085> in the Red<WH5488> Sea<WH3220>.

Behold <WH5927>, he shall come up and fly<WH1675> as the eagle<WH5404>, and spread<WH6566> out his wings<WH3671> against Bozrah<WH1224>: and the heart<WH3820> of the mighty men<WH1368> of Edom<WH123> at that day<WH3117> shall be as the heart<WH3820> of a woman<WH802> in her pangs<WH6887>.

Of Damascus<WH1834>. Hamath<WH2574> is confounded<WH954>, and Arpad<WH774>; for they have heard<WH8085> evil<WH7451> tidings<WH8052>, they are melted<WH4127> away<WH1674>: there is sorrow on the sea<WH3220>; it cannot<WH3201> be quiet<WH8252>.

Damascus <WH1834> is waxed feeble<WH7503>, she turneth<WH6437> herself to flee<WH5127>, and trembling<WH7374> hath seized<WH2388> on her<WH6869>: anguish and sorrows<WH2256> have taken<WH270> hold of her<WH3205>, as of a woman in travail.
How is the city<WH5892> of praise<WH8416> not forsaken<WH5800>, the city<WH7151> of my joy<WH4885>?

Therefore her young men<WH970> shall fall<WH5307> in her streets<WH7339>, and all the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> shall be brought to silence<WH1826> in that day<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
And I will kindle<WH3341> a fire<WH784> in the wall<WH2346> of Damascus<WH1834>, and it shall devour<WH398> the palaces<WH759> of Ben-hadad<WH1130>.

Of Kedar<WH6938>, and of the kingdoms<WH4467> of Hazor<WH2674>, which Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> smote<WH5221>. Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Arise<WH6965> ye<WH5927>, go up to Kedar<WH6938>, and destroy<WH7703> the children<WH1121> of the east<WH6924>.

Their tents<WH168> and their flocks<WH6629> shall they take<WH5375>; they shall carry<WH5375> away for themselves their curtains<WH3407>, and all their vessels<WH3627>, and their camels<WH1581>; and they shall cry<WH7121> unto them<WH4032>, Terror on every side<WH5439>!

Flee <WH5127> ye<WH5110>, wander far off<WH3966>, dwell<WH3427> in the depths<WH6009>, O ye inhabitants<WH3427> of Hazor<WH2674>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; for Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> hath taken counsel<WH6098> against you<WH2803>, and hath conceived a purpose against you<WH4284>.

Arise <WH6965>, get you up<WH5927> unto a nation<WH1471> that is at ease<WH7961>, that dwelleth<WH3427> without care<WH983>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; that have neither gates<WH1817> nor bars<WH1280>, that dwell<WH7931> alone<WH910>.

And their camels<WH1581> shall be a booty<WH957>, and the multitude<WH1995> of their cattle<WH4735> a spoil<WH7998>: and I will scatter<WH2219> unto all winds<WH7307> them that have the corners<WH6285> of their hair<WH7112> cut off<WH935>; and I will bring their calamity<WH343> from every side<WH5676> of them<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.

And Hazor<WH2674> shall be a dwelling-place<WH4583> of jackals<WH8577>, a desolation<WH8077> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>: no man<WH376> shall dwell<WH3427> there<WH1121>, neither shall any son of man<WH120> sojourn therein<WH1481>.

The word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> concerning Elam<WH5867>, in the beginning<WH7225> of the reign<WH4438> of Zedekiah<WH6667> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, saying<WH559>,
Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>: Behold<WH7665>, I will break the bow<WH7198> of Elam<WH5867>, the chief<WH7225> of their might<WH1369>.

And upon Elam<WH5867> will I bring<WH935> the four<WH702> winds<WH7307> from the four<WH702> quarters<WH7098> of heaven<WH8064>, and will scatter<WH2219> them toward all those winds<WH7307>; and there shall be no nation<WH1471> whither the outcasts<WH5080> of Elam<WH5867> shall not come<WH935>.

And I will cause Elam<WH5867> to be dismayed<WH2865> before<WH6440> their enemies<WH341>, and before<WH6440> them that seek<WH1245> their life<WH5315>; and I will bring<WH935> evil<WH7451> upon them<WH2740>, even my fierce anger<WH639>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; and I will send<WH7971> the sword<WH2719> after<WH310> them<WH3615>, till I have consumed them;
and I will set<WH7760> my throne<WH3678> in Elam<WH5867>, and will destroy<WH6> from thence king<WH4428> and princes<WH8269>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.
But it shall come to pass in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117>, that I will bring back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Elam<WH5867>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.
